statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 5 \\ -5 \\ -6 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -16 \\ 18 \\ -14 \\ -8 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ 4 \\ -2 \\ 2 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 0 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 5 \\ -5 \\ -6 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -6 \\ -5 \\ 0 \\ -2 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -16 \\ 18 \\ -14 \\ -8 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
